On 10/18/05, Robert Watkins <yahoo@...> wrote:
>
> On 10/19/05, Eug=
ene Kuleshov <eu@...> wrote:
> > I wish your statement would be true. =
Unfortunately it only work for
> > statically bound test cases. If tests ar=
e returned from the suite
> > method that is adding them dynamically (e.g. =
from external config or
> > captured data) in my knowledge none of the IDE =
would allow to restart
> > specific test case and you'll have to run the wh=
ole suite.
>
> Umm.... it works for me in Eclipse and in IntelliJ. I simply=
 click on
> the failing test and select "Run".
>
> And I use the data-drive=
n test approach extensively as well.


Again, I think there is some misunde=
rstanding.

I think Eugene is referring to the scenario where your TestCase=
 is created
in a suite and is passed parameters in its constructor.

In thi=
s case, just pointing at the test method and clicking on Run will
obviously=
 run the test method with the default value, not the one with the
right par=
ameter.

As I said, it's a problem that is independent of the testing frame=
work you
use (and I actually have figured out a way for the TestNG Eclipse =
plug-in to
directly use a @DataProvider for that, so that all you need to d=
o is to
point Eclipse to the data provider you want to use and it will invo=
ke the
test with that specific data).

--
C=E9dric
http://testng.org
